Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2010 10:15PM nervouswreckagain wrote: I am new to the forum and am not sure whether it is appropriate to post this here or if I should have started a new topic but here goes - I had DCIS & a right mastectomy in 2003 (age 36, thank heavens my gyn sent me for a mammogram at 35)  & tamoxifen for 5 years, no chemo or radiation. Each year I go for a mammogram of my left breast and then a follow-up with my surgeon and each year I am freaked out. This year they did the mammogram, then did spot compressions, then did an ultrasound (I was totally freaked out by now!) and I was told I have 2 minimally complex cysts and 1 simple cyst and that I should return for a follow-up ultrasound in 6 months. This was on Friday and I am being consumed by my thoughts. I do trust my surgeon when he says it is fine to wait 6 months but my mind keeps going to the absolutely worst places. Last night (always the worst time for thoughts) I had pretty much decided I should go get a left mastectomy too. I know I am so lucky, why can't I get a hold of myself?
Posts.Title: to be alarmed or not to be alarmed urcherished Ann68

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2010 06:20AM nervouswreckagain wrote: All I can tell you is that the waiting and worrying are the worst part! Don't be afraid to try to call to get your results! I think it is normal to be stressed, I know I always get that way! Chances are that you probably are worrying for nothing but that won't stop you from worrying until you actually know!  Thinking of you!
Posts.Title: to be alarmed or not to be alarmed urcherished Ann68

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2016 10:47AM nervouswreckagain wrote: all benign, follow up mammogram in 6 months.

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2013 01:01PM nervouswreckagain wrote: So my report says clinically insignificant changes. I'm to get a mammogram in 6 months and have my surgeon review it, then if all looks ok, I go back to annual visits.  I think I may have chickened out on the prophylactic mastectomy at this point.  My BS said that I have done so well for 10 years and there's no need for it.  Also taking into account leaf's information I may wait and see if it keeps weighing on my mind.  Any thoughts?

No reconstruction- Happy w/your decision? marlee1 quietpools

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2011 01:18PM - edited Jan 15, 2011 07:18AM by nervouswreckagain I had a right side mastectomy 7 1/2 years ago. Every time I have to go for a mammogram on my other breast I am a nervous wreck. Last time I went, they had to do additional images and then give me an ultrasound which revealed 2 or 3 small cysts, one of which was minimally complex so now I have to go for another ultrasound in 6 months. I am starting to wonder if life would be easier and less stressful with another mastectomy. I think it would be nice to be not have to wear a bra and prosthetic because I am not comfortable with the lopsided look in public. I met my husband AFTER I had the first one and he has no problem with it although I must admit I would definitely miss the sexy sensations that I have experienced since meeting him! Any thoughts would be appreciated!
Posts.Title: No reconstruction- Happy w/your decision? marlee1 quietpools
